TITLE: Installing a Specific EmulatorJS Core via npm (bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command installs a single, specific core package using npm by replacing `<core-name>` with the actual name of the desired core. This allows for installing only the necessary cores instead of the entire package. Requires Node.js and npm installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/data/cores/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @emulatorjs/core-<core-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Local Server with NPM
DESCRIPTION: This snippet describes how to start a local development server using npm (Node Package Manager). This is crucial for local development and testing of the EmulatorJS project. It uses npm's `i` command to install dependencies and `start` to initiate the server, allowing developers to test changes locally before deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting EmulatorJS Language
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to set the language for the EmulatorJS instance.  Assign an empty string to the `EJS_language` variable. If a translation file is not found, it will default to English.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/data/localization/readme.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
EJS_language = ''; //language
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Minification Script with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to start the minification process by running a custom script labeled 'minify' using Node.js. It assumes that a corresponding script is defined in the project's package.json or is available in the environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/minify/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
node run minify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running NPM Install to Set Up Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the command to install project dependencies via npm in the terminal, ensuring all necessary packages are available for the minification process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/minify/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
npm i
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing All EmulatorJS Cores via npm (bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the entire `@emulatorjs/cores` package using npm. It includes all stable core implementations available in the package. Requires Node.js and npm installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/data/cores/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @emulatorjs/cores
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing EmulatorJS Core Module with NPM - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This Bash command installs the EmulatorJS core package specified by EJS_CORE_NAME into your Node.js project using npm. The command requires npm to be installed and should be run in your project directory. Replace <!-- EJS_CORE_NAME --> with the desired core identifier to fetch the corresponding stable EmulatorJS core package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/data/cores/core-README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @emulatorjs/core-<!-- EJS_CORE_NAME -->
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring VSCode settings for EmulatorJS contributions
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for Visual Studio Code that disables automatic formatting to maintain consistency with the EmulatorJS project's coding standards. These settings should be added to .vscode/settings.json file before submitting pull requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "diffEditor.ignoreTrimWhitespace": false,
    "editor.formatOnPaste": false,
    "editor.formatOnSave": false,
    "editor.formatOnSaveMode": "modifications"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing All EmulatorJS Cores with NPM - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This Bash command utilizes npm to install all available EmulatorJS core modules for your project. It requires an npm-compatible environment and can be run from any project directory. The @emulatorjs/cores package bundles multiple core modules, facilitating the setup for projects requiring several emulator systems. Ensure network access for npm registry and necessary permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/emulatorjs/emulatorjs/blob/main/data/cores/core-README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @emulatorjs/cores
```
